name: Tactical Beanie
description: Lightweight tactical beanie providing minimal protection while maintaining maximum mobility and stealth profile.
notes: Minimal protection headwear designed for stealth operations where concealment is more important than armor.
tips: Use when you need to maintain a low profile. The minimal weight won't slow you down, but don't expect much protection.

name: OP Fast "Snowing"
description: Special edition OP Fast helmet with winter camouflage pattern. High-quality tactical protection with seasonal aesthetics.
notes: Limited edition winter-themed OP Fast helmet. Same protection as standard model with unique winter camouflage pattern.
tips: Solid Class 4 protection with good durability. The winter pattern makes it perfect for snow environments while maintaining tactical effectiveness.

name: OP Fast "Reindeer"
description: Special edition OP Fast helmet with festive reindeer pattern. Combines tactical protection with holiday spirit.
notes: Festive edition OP Fast helmet with unique reindeer pattern. Slightly heavier than the standard model but offers the same protection.
tips: Shows your holiday spirit while maintaining serious protection. The extra weight is minimal and doesn't significantly impact mobility.

name: Delta Helmet
description: High-quality tactical helmet providing excellent protection for operators in hostile environments. Features advanced materials and ergonomic design.
notes: Tactical helmet designed for special operations. Provides reliable head protection while maintaining good mobility.
tips: Excellent balance of protection and weight. The Class 4 armor rating stops most rifle rounds while keeping head movement agile.

name: Delta Helmet LE
description: Law enforcement variant of the Delta helmet with enhanced durability and improved damage resistance for extended operations.
notes: Enhanced version of the Delta helmet with improved materials and construction for law enforcement applications.
tips: Superior durability compared to the standard Delta. Takes less damage per hit, making it ideal for extended engagements.

name: OP HighProtection
description: Advanced tactical helmet with superior protection and integrated systems. Designed for high-threat environments.
notes: High-end tactical helmet offering Class 5 protection with excellent coverage. Heavy but provides superior defense against high-penetration rounds.
tips: Ideal for players facing heavily armed opponents. The weight penalty is significant but the protection is worth it for dangerous engagements.

name: Safety First
description: Basic industrial safety helmet repurposed for combat use. Lightweight but offers minimal protection.
notes: Entry-level head protection that's better than nothing. Very lightweight and cheap, making it suitable for budget builds.
tips: Good starter helmet for new players. Won't stop much but provides basic protection against low-caliber rounds and debris.

name: Lightweight Helmet
description: Streamlined tactical helmet balancing protection and mobility. Popular choice for fast-moving operators.
notes: Well-balanced helmet offering decent protection without significant mobility penalties. Good all-around choice.
tips: Excellent for players who prioritize movement speed while still wanting reasonable head protection. Works well for most mid-tier encounters.

name: Black Parachute Training Helmet
description: Military training helmet in tactical black finish. Lightweight design originally for paratrooper training.
notes: Training helmet adapted for combat use. Low durability but very lightweight and affordable.
tips: Good budget option for players who want minimal weight penalty. The black finish provides better camouflage in urban environments.

name: SWAT Helmet
description: Heavy-duty tactical helmet used by special weapons and tactics units. Features enhanced protection and communication systems.
notes: Professional-grade tactical helmet with comprehensive face protection. Heavy but offers excellent protection against rifle rounds.
tips: Solid mid-tier choice for serious operators. The extra weight is offset by significantly improved survivability in firefights.

name: EVIRS Helmet
description: High-end tactical helmet with advanced ballistic protection. Features integrated communication systems and night vision mounting capabilities.
notes: Premium tactical helmet offering Class 5 protection with excellent durability. Designed for high-threat environments.
tips: High-end helmet with excellent protection but significant weight penalty. Best used by experienced operators who can manage the mobility trade-off.

name: EVIRS Helmet NE
description: Night-enhanced variant of the EVIRS helmet with integrated night vision systems and improved communication equipment.
notes: Enhanced EVIRS variant with integrated night vision capabilities. Slightly heavier due to additional electronics.
tips: Premium night operations helmet. The integrated NV systems justify the extra weight for night missions.

name: Black EVIRS Helmet
description: Tactical black variant of the EVIRS helmet system. Same protection as the standard model with a low-visibility finish.
notes: Low-visibility black variant of the premium EVIRS helmet system. Popular among special operations units.
tips: Same excellent protection as the standard EVIRS with better concealment. Ideal for urban operations.

name: Skull Face Ops Helmet
description: Intimidating tactical helmet with skull face design. Lightweight construction with moderate protection for psychological warfare operations.
notes: Unique skull-faced helmet designed for psychological operations. Lighter than most Class 4 helmets.
tips: Good protection-to-weight ratio for a Class 4 helmet. The distinctive appearance can be intimidating to enemies.

name: Tsh-4M Helmet
description: Soviet-era tank crew helmet adapted for infantry use. Basic protection with excellent sound dampening properties.
notes: Repurposed Soviet tank crew helmet. High durability compensates for minimal protection level.
tips: Very affordable basic protection. The high durability makes it last longer than other low-tier helmets.

name: M1 Helmet
description: Classic World War II era American infantry helmet. Proven design with moderate protection and historical significance.
notes: Classic WWII-era design that's stood the test of time. Reliable mid-tier protection at an affordable price.
tips: Good balance of protection, weight, and cost. A solid choice for players who want Class 3 protection without breaking the bank.

name: Warrior Full Face Helmet
description: Full-face protection helmet with integrated visor. Excellent coverage and durability with moderate weight penalty.
notes: Full face protection helmet with excellent coverage. Surprisingly lightweight for the level of protection offered.
tips: Excellent all-around helmet with full facial protection. The comprehensive coverage makes it ideal for close-quarters combat.

name: 6B47 Helmet
description: Russian military combat helmet providing reliable protection for infantry operations. Standard issue for modern Russian forces with proven battlefield effectiveness.
notes: Standard military helmet with good protection against small arms fire.
tips: Affordable Class 3 protection that works well against most pistol rounds and low-penetration rifle ammunition.

name: ACH Helmet (Green)
description: Advanced Combat Helmet in woodland green camouflage. Modern military design with enhanced ballistic protection and compatibility with tactical accessories.
notes: Advanced military helmet with face shield compatibility and superior ballistic protection.
tips: Excellent protection against rifle rounds. Can mount face shields for additional protection.

name: ACH Helmet (Black)
description: Advanced Combat Helmet in tactical black finish. Identical protection to the green variant with a different color scheme for urban operations.
notes: Advanced military helmet with face shield compatibility and superior ballistic protection.
tips: Excellent protection against rifle rounds. Can mount face shields for additional protection.

name: Motorcycle Helmet
description: Civilian motorcycle helmet repurposed for combat use. Offers basic protection and is lightweight, making it popular among scavengers and new operators.
notes: Civilian helmet providing basic protection. Good for new operators on a budget.
tips: Affordable starter helmet. Protects against pistol rounds and shrapnel but vulnerable to rifle fire.

name: Kiver-M Helmet
description: Russian special forces helmet with integrated face shield mount. Popular among law enforcement and military units for urban operations.
notes: Special forces helmet with good protection and face shield compatibility.
tips: Solid Class 3 protection with better blunt damage reduction than the 6B47. Compatible with face shields.

name: LH250 Pilot Helmet
description: Lightweight pilot helmet designed for aviation use. Offers basic protection while maintaining excellent visibility and comfort for extended operations.
notes: Lightweight aviation helmet with minimal protection but excellent mobility.
tips: Very light weight makes this ideal for long missions where mobility is key. Can mount specialized pilot equipment.

name: RYS-T Heavy Helmet
description: Ultra-heavy tactical helmet providing maximum ballistic protection. Used by elite special forces units for high-threat environments where protection is paramount.
notes: Maximum protection helmet capable of stopping high-caliber rifle rounds. Extremely heavy but nearly impenetrable.
tips: The ultimate in head protection. Can stop armor-piercing rounds but the weight significantly impacts mobility and stamina.

name: RYS-T Heavy Helmet (Bonecrusher)
description: Ultra-heavy tactical helmet with custom Bonecrusher paint scheme. Identical protection to the standard RYS-T with a distinctive skull-themed finish for intimidation factor.
notes: Maximum protection helmet with intimidating skull design. Same protection as standard RYS-T.
tips: Identical performance to the standard RYS-T but with a distinctive appearance that may make you a priority target.

name: Black Beret
description: Military-style black beret offering minimal protection. Worn more for identification and morale than actual ballistic defense.
notes: Symbolic military headwear with virtually no ballistic protection.
tips: Extremely lightweight but offers almost no protection. Better than nothing for identification purposes.

name: Camouflage Beret
description: Military-style camouflage beret offering minimal protection. Provides basic concealment and unit identification in field operations.
notes: Camouflage beret with minimal protection but better concealment than the black variant.
tips: Virtually no protection but the camo pattern may help with concealment in woodland environments.

name: Green Military Cap
description: Standard issue military field cap in olive drab green. Provides minimal protection while offering sun protection and unit identification.
notes: Basic military field cap with minimal ballistic protection.
tips: Lightweight headwear that provides sun protection and basic concealment but no meaningful ballistic defense.

name: Red Beret
description: Distinguished military red beret traditionally worn by elite airborne units. Offers minimal protection but significant morale and identification value.
notes: Elite unit beret with slightly better protection than standard berets.
tips: Symbol of elite airborne units. Marginally better protection than other berets but still primarily ceremonial.
